dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 11, pp. 127-142. An account of her final conversion after the birth of her daughter Theresa. She describes the struggle and anguish she felt while preparing for her and Theresa's Baptism--knowing her decision would end her relationship with her agnostic husband. DDLW #211 1938-01-13 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday/daytext.cfm?TextID=211
